preflight: This installer targets only ESP32-S3 boards; the flash tool verifies the chip family before writing.

fieldChecklist.title: Browser
fieldChecklist.detail: Use Chrome or Edge on desktop (or Chrome on Android 120+) so WebSerial is available.

fieldChecklist.title: Cable
fieldChecklist.detail: Prefer a USB-C data cable (not a power-only cable) and a powered USB port; some cables share grounds poorly.

fieldChecklist.title: Boot mode
fieldChecklist.detail: Hold BOOT (GPIO0) while plugging in, then release after the dialogue opens to keep the chip in flashing mode.

fieldChecklist.title: Tracking
fieldChecklist.detail: Note the unitâ€™s MAC/serial before flashing; the factory path wipes `thing_name` and the secure cert.

notes: Binaries and manifests live in the us-east-2 S3 bucket with a fixed partition table (OTA table at 0x19000) to match the egg layout.
Recovery flow preserves provisioning if you leave the Erase checkbox unchecked; factory reset requires reprovisioning.
Keep a provisioning phone or tablet handy when doing a factory reset so the device can be reprovisioned immediately.

device.name: Mother Hen Egg
device.tagline: Field-ready recovery for damaged or locked eggs.
device.description: A tailor-made ESP Web Tools experience that bundles two flash paths (preserve data or factory reset) alongside field guidance and manifest validation.

manifests.title: Recover (keep provisioning)
manifests.summary: If you leave the Erase checkbox untouched, the EEPROM, provisioning flags, and secure cert stay intact. This is the go-to choice when the device recently lost wifi or crashed.
manifests.note: The dialog will warn about erasing data; just skip that step unless you need to start over.

manifests.title: Factory reset (reprovision)
manifests.summary: Tick the Erase box to fully wipe `thing_name`, secure certs, and Wi-Fi entries so provisioning can run from scratch.
manifests.note: Expect to reprovision the device after flashing; keep POP/code ready.
